symbols.name: sap.zen.dsh
symbols.description: Design Studio Runtime Library. Intended only to be used within S/4 HANA Fiori applications.

nodes.name: sap.zen.dsh.AnalyticGrid
nodes.description: Control for embedding a Design Studio Analytic Grid in an S/4 HANA Fiori application

nodes.name: sap.zen.dsh.Dsh
nodes.description: Control for embedding a Design Studio application full-screen in an S/4 HANA Fiori application

symbols.title: namespace sap.zen.dsh

symbols.name: sap.zen.dsh.AnalyticGrid
symbols.description: Control for embedding a Design Studio Analytic Grid in an S/4 HANA Fiori application

experimental.text: API is incomplete and may change incompatibly

properties.name: queryName
properties.description: Name of the Query to bind the AnalyticGrid to.

properties.name: selection
properties.description: A SelectionVariant specifying the initial selection state used by the AnalyticGrid. Depending on the specific query and selection variant state, this will result in setting one or more variables' values and setting one or more filters on the datasource.

properties.name: state
properties.description: A string representing the current state of the analytic grid, including data selection and navigation state. Intended to be used for saving and recreating inner application state in navigation scenarios, for example.

parameters.name: sId
parameters.description: id for the new control, generated automatically if no id is given

parameters.name: mSettings
parameters.description: initial settings for the new control

constructor.description:
Constructor for a new AnalyticGrid.

Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

events.name: selectionChange

parameters.name: selection
parameters.description: A SelectionVariant specifying the current selection state of the AnalyticGrid.

events.description: Event is triggered when the selection is changed.

events.name: stateChange

parameters.name: state
parameters.description: Serialized state string.

events.description: Event is triggered when the state of the AnalyticGrid is changed.

methods.name: attachSelectionChange

returnValue.description: Reference to this in order to allow method chaining

parameters.name: oData
parameters.description: An application-specific payload object that will be passed to the event handler along with the event object when firing the event

parameters.name: fnFunction
parameters.description: The function to be called when the event occurs

parameters.name: oListener
parameters.description: Context object to call the event handler with. Defaults to this sap.zen.dsh.AnalyticGrid itself

methods.description:
Attaches event handler fnFunction to the selectionChange event of this sap.zen.dsh.AnalyticGrid.

When called, the context of the event handler (its this) will be bound to oListener if specified, otherwise it will be bound to this sap.zen.dsh.AnalyticGrid itself.

Event is triggered when the selection is changed.

methods.name: attachStateChange

returnValue.description: Reference to this in order to allow method chaining

parameters.name: oData
parameters.description: An application-specific payload object that will be passed to the event handler along with the event object when firing the event

parameters.name: fnFunction
parameters.description: The function to be called when the event occurs

parameters.name: oListener
parameters.description: Context object to call the event handler with. Defaults to this sap.zen.dsh.AnalyticGrid itself

methods.description:
Attaches event handler fnFunction to the stateChange event of this sap.zen.dsh.AnalyticGrid.

When called, the context of the event handler (its this) will be bound to oListener if specified, otherwise it will be bound to this sap.zen.dsh.AnalyticGrid itself.

Event is triggered when the state of the AnalyticGrid is changed.

methods.name: detachSelectionChange

returnValue.description: Reference to this in order to allow method chaining

parameters.name: fnFunction
parameters.description: The function to be called, when the event occurs

parameters.name: oListener
parameters.description: Context object on which the given function had to be called

methods.description:
Detaches event handler fnFunction from the selectionChange event of this sap.zen.dsh.AnalyticGrid.

The passed function and listener object must match the ones used for event registration.

methods.name: detachStateChange

returnValue.description: Reference to this in order to allow method chaining

parameters.name: fnFunction
parameters.description: The function to be called, when the event occurs

parameters.name: oListener
parameters.description: Context object on which the given function had to be called

methods.description:
Detaches event handler fnFunction from the stateChange event of this sap.zen.dsh.AnalyticGrid.

The passed function and listener object must match the ones used for event registration.

methods.name: sap.zen.dsh.AnalyticGrid.extend

returnValue.description: Created class / constructor function

parameters.name: sClassName
parameters.description: Name of the class being created

parameters.name: oClassInfo
parameters.description: Object literal with information about the class

parameters.name: FNMetaImpl
parameters.description: Constructor function for the metadata object; if not given, it defaults to the metadata implementation used by this class

methods.description:
Creates a new subclass of class sap.zen.dsh.AnalyticGrid with name sClassName and enriches it with the information contained in oClassInfo.

oClassInfo might contain the same kind of information as described in sap.ui.core.Control.extend.

symbols.deprecatedText: Deprecated as of version 1.89.0. Please use the WD Grid control instead.

symbols.name: sap.zen.dsh.ValueHelpDialog
symbols.description: The ValueHelpDialog control can be used to implement a value help for an input field.

properties.name: basicSearchText
properties.description:
Defines the value for the basic search field. The value is set into the basic search field of the filter bar used.

Since: 1.24.

properties.name: descriptionKey
properties.description:
Defines the key of the column used for the token text.

Since: 1.24.

properties.name: displayFormat
properties.description:
Represents the display format of the range values. With the displayFormat value UpperCase, the entered value of the range (condition) is converted to uppercase letters.

Since: 1.24.

properties.name: filterMode
properties.description:
Sets the dialog into a filter mode, which only shows ranges (conditions) and hides the tokens.

Since: 1.24.

properties.name: key
properties.description:
Defines the key of the column used for the internal key handling. The value of the column is used for the token key and also to identify the row in the table.

Since: 1.24.

properties.name: keys
properties.description:
Defines the list of additional keys of the column used for the internal key handling.

Since: 1.24.

properties.name: maxExcludeRanges
properties.description:
Defines the maximum number of exclude ranges.

Since: 1.24.

properties.name: maxIncludeRanges
properties.description:
Defines the maximum number of include ranges.

Since: 1.24.

properties.name: supportRanges
properties.description:
Enables the ranges (conditions) feature in the dialog.

Since: 1.24.

properties.name: supportRangesOnly
properties.description:
If this property is set to true, the value help dialog only supports the ranges (conditions) feature.

Since: 1.24.

properties.name: tokenDisplayBehaviour
properties.description:
Represents how the item token text should be displayed in ValueHelpDialog. Use one of the valid sap.ui.comp.smartfilterbar.DisplayBehaviour values.

Since: 1.24.

aggregations.name: filterBar
aggregations.description: Allows you to add a FilterBar or SmartFilterBar control to the value help dialog.

parameters.name: sId
parameters.description: ID for the new control, generated automatically if no ID is given

parameters.name: mSettings
parameters.description: Initial settings for the new control

constructor.description:
Constructor for a new valuehelpdialog/ValueHelpDialog.

Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

events.name: cancel
events.description:
This event is fired when the Cancel button is pressed.

Since: 1.24.

events.name: ok

parameters.name: tokens
parameters.description: The array of tokens created or modified on the ValueHelpDialog.

events.description:
This event is fired when the OK button is pressed.

Since: 1.24.

events.name: selectionChange

parameters.name: tableSelectionParams
parameters.description: The RowSelectionChange event parameter from the hosted table that contains the selected items.

parameters.name: updateTokens
parameters.description: Returns an array of objects which represents all selected row tokens. The object contains the token key, the row object data from the model, and the information if the token is selected. [{sKey, oRow, bSelect}, ...]

parameters.name: useDefault
parameters.description: Can be set to true to execute the default behaviour of the ValueHelpDialog.

events.description:
This event is fired when the user selects an item in the items table.

Note: The event will only be raised when the dialog gets a table instance from outside via setTable.

Since: 1.32.

events.name: tokenRemove

parameters.name: tokenKeys
parameters.description: The array of token keys that has been removed.

parameters.name: useDefault
parameters.description: Can be set to true to execute the default behaviour of ValueHelpDialog.

events.description:
This event is fired when the user removes one or multiple existing token(s) from the dialog.

Note: The event will only be raised when the dialog gets a table instance from outside via setTable.

Since: 1.32.

events.name: updateSelection

parameters.name: tokenKeys
parameters.description: The array of existing token keys for which the selection in the table has to be updated.

parameters.name: useDefault
parameters.description: Can be set to true to execute the default behavior of ValueHelpDialog.

events.description:
This event is fired when the table gets an update and all existing tokens must be selected in the table.

Note: The event will only be raised when the dialog gets a table instance from outside via setTable.

Since: 1.32.

methods.name: attachCancel

returnValue.description: Reference to this in order to allow method chaining

parameters.name: oData
parameters.description: An application-specific payload object that will be passed to the event handler along with the event object when firing the event

parameters.name: fnFunction
parameters.description: The function to be called when the event occurs

parameters.name: oListener
parameters.description: Context object to call the event handler with. Defaults to this sap.zen.dsh.ValueHelpDialog itself

methods.description:
Attaches event handler fnFunction to the cancel event of this sap.zen.dsh.ValueHelpDialog.

When called, the context of the event handler (its this) will be bound to oListener if specified, otherwise it will be bound to this sap.zen.dsh.ValueHelpDialog itself.

This event is fired when the Cancel button is pressed.

When called, the context of the event handler (its this) will be bound to oListener if specified, otherwise it will be bound to this sap.zen.dsh.ValueHelpDialog itself.

This event is fired when the OK button is pressed.

When called, the context of the event handler (its this) will be bound to oListener if specified, otherwise it will be bound to this sap.zen.dsh.ValueHelpDialog itself.

This event is fired when the user selects an item in the items table.

Note: The event will only be raised when the dialog gets a table instance from outside via setTable.

returnValue.description: Reference to this in order to allow method chaining

parameters.name: oData

parameters.description: Context object to call the event handler with. Defaults to this sap.zen.dsh.ValueHelpDialog itself

When called, the context of the event handler (its this) will be bound to oListener if specified, otherwise it will be bound to this sap.zen.dsh.ValueHelpDialog itself.

Note: The event will only be raised when the dialog gets a table instance from outside via setTable.

returnValue.description: Reference to this in order to allow method chaining

parameters.name: fnFunction
parameters.description: The function to be called when the event occurs

When called, the context of the event handler (its this) will be bound to oListener if specified, otherwise it will be bound to this sap.zen.dsh.ValueHelpDialog itself.

This event is fired when the table gets an update and all existing tokens must be selected in the table.

Note: The event will only be raised when the dialog gets a table instance from outside via setTable.

parameters.description: Context object on which the given function had to be called

methods.description:
Detaches event handler fnFunction from the updateSelection event of this sap.zen.dsh.ValueHelpDialog.

The passed function and listener object must match the ones used for event registration.

methods.name: sap.zen.dsh.ValueHelpDialog.extend

parameters.name: FNMetaImpl
parameters.description: Constructor function for the metadata object; if not given, it defaults to the metadata implementation used by this class

methods.description:
Creates a new subclass of class sap.zen.dsh.ValueHelpDialog with name sClassName and enriches it with the information contained in oClassInfo.

oClassInfo might contain the same kind of information as described in sap.m.Dialog.extend.

parameters.description: The RowSelectionChange event parameter from the hosted table that contains the selected items.

parameters.name: updateTokens
parameters.description: Returns an array of objects which represents all selected row tokens. The object contains the token key, the row object data from the model, and the information if the token is selected. [{sKey, oRow, bSelect}, ...]

methods.name: getBasicSearchText

returnValue.description: Value of property basicSearchText

methods.description:
Gets current value of property basicSearchText.

Defines the value for the basic search field. The value is set into the basic search field of the filter bar used.

Default value is empty string.

methods.name: getDescriptionKey

returnValue.description: Value of property descriptionKey

methods.description:
Gets current value of property descriptionKey.

Defines the key of the column used for the token text.

Default value is empty string.

methods.name: getDisplayFormat

returnValue.description: Value of property displayFormat

methods.description:
Gets current value of property displayFormat.

Represents the display format of the range values. With the displayFormat value UpperCase, the entered value of the range (condition) is converted to uppercase letters.

Default value is empty string.

methods.name: getFilterMode

returnValue.description: Value of property filterMode

methods.description:
Gets current value of property filterMode.

Sets the dialog into a filter mode, which only shows ranges (conditions) and hides the tokens.

Default value is false.

methods.name: getKey

returnValue.description: Value of property key

methods.description:
Gets current value of property key.

Defines the key of the column used for the internal key handling. The value of the column is used for the token key and also to identify the row in the table.

Default value is empty string.

methods.name: getKeys

returnValue.description: Value of property keys

methods.description:
Gets current value of property keys.

Defines the list of additional keys of the column used for the internal key handling.

methods.name: getMaxExcludeRanges

returnValue.description: Value of property maxExcludeRanges

methods.description:
Gets current value of property maxExcludeRanges.

Defines the maximum number of exclude ranges.

Default value is "-1".

methods.name: getMaxIncludeRanges

returnValue.description: Value of property maxIncludeRanges

methods.description:
Gets current value of property maxIncludeRanges.

Defines the maximum number of include ranges.

Default value is "-1".

methods.name: sap.zen.dsh.ValueHelpDialog.getMetadata

returnValue.description: Metadata object describing this class

methods.description: Returns a metadata object for class sap.zen.dsh.ValueHelpDialog.

methods.name: getSupportMultiselect

returnValue.description: Value of property supportMultiselect

methods.description:
Gets current value of property supportMultiselect.

Enables multi-selection in the table used.

Default value is true.

methods.name: getSupportRanges

returnValue.description: Value of property supportRanges

methods.description:
Gets current value of property supportRanges.

Enables the ranges (conditions) feature in the dialog.

Default value is false.

methods.name: getSupportRangesOnly

returnValue.description: Value of property supportRangesOnly

methods.description:
Gets current value of property supportRangesOnly.

If this property is set to true, the value help dialog only supports the ranges (conditions) feature.

Default value is false.

methods.name: getTable

returnValue.description: the used table instance

methods.description: getTable Gives access to the internal table instance.

methods.name: getTokenDisplayBehaviour

returnValue.description: Value of property tokenDisplayBehaviour

methods.description:
Gets current value of property tokenDisplayBehaviour.

Represents how the item token text should be displayed in ValueHelpDialog. Use one of the valid sap.ui.comp.smartfilterbar.DisplayBehaviour values.

Default value is empty string.

parameters.description: New value for property descriptionKey

When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored.

Default value is empty string.

When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored.

Default value is empty string.

methods.name: setRangeKeyFields

parameters.name: aRangeKeyFields
parameters.description: An array of range KeyFields [{key: "CompanyCode", label: "ID"}, {key:"CompanyName", label : "Name"}]

methods.description: setRangeKeyFields Sets a RangeKeyFields array. This method allows you to specify the KeyFields for the ranges. You can set an array of objects with Key and Label properties to define the key fields.

methods.name: setTable

parameters.name: oTable
parameters.description: The used table control instance

methods.description: setTable Sets the table used in the value help dialog. If not used, the dialog creates a sap.ui.table.Table or sap.m.Table instance internally.

methods.name: setTokenDisplayBehaviour

returnValue.description: Reference to this in order to allow method chaining

parameters.name: sTokenDisplayBehaviour
parameters.description: New value for property tokenDisplayBehaviour

methods.description:
Sets a new value for property tokenDisplayBehaviour.

Represents how the item token text should be displayed in ValueHelpDialog. Use one of the valid sap.ui.comp.smartfilterbar.DisplayBehaviour values.

When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored.

Default value is empty string.

methods.name: setTokens

parameters.name: aTokens
parameters.description: An array of token controls

methods.description: Sets the array of tokens. The sap.m.Tokens are added to the dialog tokenizer Selected Items or Excluded Items. Normal tokens are added to the Selected Items tokenizer only and are selected in the table. new sap.m.Token({key: "0001", text:"SAP A.G. (0001)"}); Tokens with the extra data with value 'range' are handled as range tokens or exclude range tokens. new sap.m.Token({key: "i1", text: "ID: a..z"}).data("range", { "exclude": false, "operation": sap.ui.comp.valuehelpdialog.ValueHelpRangeOperation.BT, "keyField": "CompanyCode", "value1": "a", "value2": "z"}); The selected items or range tokens are returned in the event parameters of the Ok event.

methods.name: update
methods.description:
Update the Control

Updates the selection of rows in the table. This function must be called after a first binding or binding update of the table. It will set a table row as selected if a token for this row exists.
